title: Using the Product Property.
text: Use the Product Property first: $$\log_{a}\left(M N\right)$$ $$=$$ $$\log_{a}\left(M\right)$$ + $$\log_{a}\left(N\right)$$.

title: Applying the Power Property to this problem.
text: Here, the Power Property on $$\log_{4}\left(x^3\right)$$ + $$\log_{4}\left(y^2\right)$$ gives $$3*\log_{4}\left(x\right)$$ + $$2*\log_{4}\left(y\right)$$

title: Simplifying.
text: Simplify the elements that you can. Here, $$\log_{4}\left(2\right)$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{1}{2}$$.

title: Putting it all together.
text: The previous steps leave the equation $$1/2+3*\log_{4}\left(x\right)+2*\log_{4}\left(y\right)$$.
speech: The previous steps leave the equation  1 divided by 2, plus, 3 times the log base 4 of x plus, 2 times the log base 4 of y .
